list.title: BIO PROM
list.subtitle: Phosphate Rich Organic Manure (PROM)
list.description: BIO PROM is a concentrated, phosphate-rich organic manure that contains 10.5% available phosphate alongside organic carbon, beneficial microbes and micronutrients. It is formulated from rock phosphate, organic matter and bio-particles to slowly release phosphorus and improve long-term soil fertility.
benefits: Slow and sustained phosphorus availability
Improves soil structure and porosity
Increases soil organic carbon and microbial activity
Enhances root development and nutrient uptake
Reduces soil erosion by improving aggregation
Acts as a buffering agent against extreme pH

usage.general: Apply 50–100 kg per acre as a basal application depending on soil test & crop.
method: Broadcast and incorporate into the top 10–15 cm of soil before sowing.
Mix with well-decomposed FYM or compost for better distribution.
Can be used in planting pits for orchards and plantation crops.
usage.timing: Apply at land preparation or at transplanting. For perennials, apply twice a year.

cropRecommendations.orchards: 2–5 kg per pit for saplings depending on pit size

list.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight. Keep bags sealed to retain moisture and biological activity.
list.safety: Non-toxic and safe for humans, animals and the environment. Use gloves when handling if you have sensitive skin.

list.title: BIO CHAR
list.subtitle: Biochar — Carbon-rich Soil Amendment
list.description: Biochar is a stable, carbon-rich product produced by pyrolysis of biomass. When added to soil, biochar improves water holding capacity, nutrient retention, microbial habitat, and contributes to long-term carbon sequestration.
benefits: Improves soil water retention and aeration
Increases nutrient density and reduces leaching
Provides habitat for beneficial soil microbes
Assists in carbon sequestration and climate mitigation
Helps stabilize soil temperature and seed germination

usage.general: Apply biochar at 0.5–5 tonnes per hectare depending on soil type and crop.
method: Mix biochar with compost or FYM before application to charge the biochar with nutrients.
Incorporate into the topsoil layer for annual crops.
Use with planting pits or potting mixes for tree saplings and horticulture.
usage.timing: Apply during land preparation or at the start of the cropping cycle.

cropRecommendations.sandySoils: Use at higher rates (2–5 t/ha) to improve water retention
cropRecommendations.claySoils: Lower rates (0.5–1.5 t/ha) can help improve structure
cropRecommendations.horticulture: Mix 10–20% biochar into the potting mix

list.storage: Keep dry and free from contamination. Seal bags to avoid dust.

list.title: BIO POTASH
list.subtitle: Potash Solubilizing Biofertilizer
list.description: BIO POTASH contains potash-solubilizing microbes and organic carriers that mobilize fixed potassium in the soil, making it available to plant roots. It promotes root growth, drought resistance and starch accumulation in grains.
benefits: Mobilizes non-exchangeable potassium in the soil
Improves plant turgor and drought resistance
Enhances root growth and carbohydrate translocation
Increases starch content in grains and overall crop quality
Boosts beneficial soil microbial activity

usage.general: Apply 50–100 kg per acre depending on soil test and crop.
method: Broadcast and incorporate during land preparation.
Apply in-furrow for row crops or mix into nursery beds.
usage.timing: Baseline application at land preparation; can supplement during active growth stages if needed.

list.safety: Safe to handle. Use protective gloves if performing large volume handling.

list.title: BIO NPK
list.subtitle: Premium Bio NPK — Microbial NPK Enhancer
list.description: Premium Bio NPK is a microbial liquid/soluble formulation that increases nitrogen fixation, solubilizes unavailable phosphates and mobilizes fixed potassium. It improves nutrient uptake efficiency and reduces the dependence on chemical NPK fertilizers.

composition.nutrientContent: Microbial enhancer — not a direct NPK replacement but reduces NPK dosages when used correctly.

benefits: Enhances atmospheric nitrogen utilization
Solubilizes unavailable forms of phosphorus
Mobilizes fixed and residual potassium
Increases drought tolerance and plant vigor
Can improve yield and quality by 20–30% under correct use

applicationMethods.soilApplication: Mix 500 ml - 1.0 L Premium Bio NPK per acre in 50 kg of well-decomposed FYM/compost and spread during land preparation.
applicationMethods.foliarSpray: Mix 500 ml - 750 ml in 150 L water and spray at 30 days after sowing/planting; repeat 2–3 times at monthly intervals for best results.
applicationMethods.dripIrrigation: Mix 500 ml - 1.0 L per acre in 100 L water and apply through drip.

list.safety: Non-toxic. Avoid ingestion. Keep away from eyes.

list.title: PLANT BOOSTER
list.subtitle: Multi-purpose liquid plant booster
list.description: Plant Booster is a liquid formulation designed to promote root and vegetative growth, partially suppress certain soil pests and nematodes, and enhance beneficial microbial populations. It reduces the need for chemical nematicides and promotes healthier seedlings.
benefits: Promotes strong root development and early vigor
Reduces incidence of some soil-borne pests
Works synergistically with biofertilizers to boost nutrient uptake
Suitable for foliar application and soil drench

usage.general: Use 5–10 ml in 1 L water depending on crop and stage.
usage.timing: Apply during early vegetative stages. If it rains within 12 hours, repeat the spray for optimal results.

general.q: Are these products safe for organic farming?
general.a: Our products are formulated using organic inputs and beneficial microbes. Certification for organic input varies by batch and region — contact us for current certification status for a particular product lot.

general.q: How do I choose the right product for my crop?
general.a: Start with a soil test to understand nutrient deficiencies. For phosphorus-poor soils use BIO PROM, for poor structure add BIO CHAR, for potassium mobility issues use BIO POTASH, and for overall nutrient efficiency try BIO NPK. Our sales team can recommend a package based on soil report.

general.q: Can these products replace chemical fertilizers entirely?
general.a: Biofertilizers improve nutrient use efficiency and can significantly reduce chemical fertilizer requirements over time. Replacement depends on soil status and crop; in many cases a combination with reduced chemical inputs gives the best results initially.

general.q: How long until I see results?
general.a: Some benefits, such as improved microbial activity and soil moisture retention, can be observed within weeks. Yield improvements typically appear within one cropping season but may be more pronounced over multiple seasons as soil improves.

soilTestGuide.title: How to collect a proper soil sample
steps: Collect soil from 10-15 spots across the field
Take samples from the top 0-15 cm layer for most crops
Mix well and take composite sample of 500 g
Send to lab in clean, labeled bag and record GPS or field ID
soilTestGuide.note: Accurate testing ensures correct product recommendations.
